Subject: Re: [junit] Proposition (?) [WAS Re: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts]
From: Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>

> "Have a way easily to configure assert-counting with a maximum increase in 
> execution speed of 1%"

if you modify the Assert class, it's not a problem (if you want the code I have it...).  But you have to change the framework and it's not pluggable.  Otherwise, I don't see how you can know when an assertion is beeing exectuted if you don't change the Assert class.

-Vladimir
subject: Re: [junit] Proposition (?) [WAS Re: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts]
